tn.ref: second year of Darius the king
tn.text: "second year of the reign of Darius the king" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])
These are all names of men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: in the sixth month, on the first day of the month
tn.text: "on the first day of the sixth month." This is the sixth month of the Hebrew calendar. The first day is near the middle of August on Western calendars. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])
"Yahweh spoke his word" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
This is the name of God that he revealed to his people in the Old Testament. See the translationWord page about Yahweh concerning how to translate this.

tn.ref: came by the hand of Haggai
tn.text: Haggai was the messenger. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
"Yahweh spoke his word." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:hag:01:01|1:1]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
AT: "came through the words (or 'mouth') of Haggai". (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]]).

tn.ref: Is it a time for you yourselves to live in your finished houses?
tn.text: AT: see UDB (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]]).
The word "house" here refers to the temple of God. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]]).
The text does not say or imply that drunkenness is a good thing. Rather, there is not enough wine to satisfy the people's thirst and not nearly enough for drunkenness.

tn.ref: the wage earner earns money only to put it into a bag full of holes
tn.text: AT: "the money you make at a job does not buy you enough" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]]).
This represents only a part of what they needed to build the Temple. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]]).

tn.ref: the declaration of Yahweh of hosts
tn.text: "what Yahweh of hosts has declared" or "what Yahweh of hosts has solemnly said"
AT: "the sky"
AT: "withhold the rains" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]]).
Dryness that will hinder or prevent the growth of plants and dry up all the water that is needed for animals or people in that area.

tn.ref: upon the new wine, upon the oil
tn.text: Wine refers to grapes and oil refers to olives. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]]).
"all the hard work you have done!" and UDB (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]]).

tn.ref: and the words of Haggai the prophet
tn.text: "when they heard the words that Haggai the prophet spoke" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]]).
AT: "Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]]).
"what Yahweh has declared" or "what Yahweh has solemnly said"
This means to motivate or influence. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]]).
The word "remnant" refers to the people that were still alive after they arrived from their captivity in Babylon and started to rebuild Jerusalem.

tn.ref: in the twenty-fourth day of the sixth month
tn.text: fourth day of the sixth month** - This is just 23 days after he received the vision. This is the sixth month of the Hebrew calendar. The twenty-fourth day is near the middle of September on Western calendars. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])

tn.ref: the second year of Darius the king
tn.text: "second year of the reign of Darius the king" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])
